intro: Jussiaea laruotteana var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Paraguay. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "pubescens." It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
